boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo
boardgame.description:
Lock ‘n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo Second Edition contains 12 new scenarios for use with the components found in Band of Heroes and Noville, Bastogne’s Outpost. From Normandy to the Hürtgen Forest, to Monte Cassino and Anzio in Italy, Battle Pack Bravo has you covered. It also includes a return to Noville, Belgium, as the Battle of the Bulge wanes down.

Battle Pack Bravo is an expansion pack of Lock ’n Load scenarios Band of Heroes and Noville, Bastogne's Outpost. It contains 12 scenarios and a new Castle map. Six of the 12 scenarios use the Band of Heroes components exclusively; the other six use components from both Band of Heroes and Noville, and two scenarios are set on the new Castle map. Two scenarios also occur on the wintry expanse of the Noville map.

Scenarios take place from Normandy to the Hürtgen Forest, at Monte Cassino and Anzio. Take part in daring prisoner rescues, slash through Normandy's Bocage with Culin-mounted Shermans, fight for Cauquigny and the La Fiere Bridge on D-Day, take on a retreating group of SS—including a Tiger—in Noville, and fight for the towns of Strass and Gey, Germany, on the edge of the Hürtgen Forest.

The scenarios are laid out in a full-color booklet, and were designed by savvy LnL specialists Dale Holmstrom, Yvan Descotes, Stéphane Tanguay, Jeff Lewis and Mark Walker.

The Castle map is printed on heavy cardstock and comes not only in its standard size (8.25” x 12.75”) but also as a free bonus X-Map, a new oversized 11” x 17” map that retains the LnL game scale but increases the size of the map and its hexes, providing a larger playing area and more space for your units and administrative markers.

Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo Second Edition brings out the Action!

boardgame.name: Doodaddy
boardgame.description:
Doodaddy is a family dice game, similar to 10,000, where each player collects points during his/her turn, which he/she may add to his total, or not, depending on how aggressively or cautiously he/she plays.

As each player rolls during his/her turn, the player is looking to score points, in the form of sets. If a roll scores any points, he may set aside any number of sets that he wants to claim points from, and either: 1) roll all remaining dice, hoping to score additional Sets., 2) roll all six dice again if all six dice have scored points, or 3) calculate the points and move on. A player has to start with 500 points to get on the table. If a roll scores nothing, the turn is forfeited, and it’s the next players turn.

Points…
a single 1 : 100
a single 5 : 50
triple of 1's : 1000
triple of 2's : 200
triple of 3's : 300
triple of 4's : 400
triple of 5's : 500
triple of 6's : 600
six-of-a-kind : Instant winner
three pair (DOODADDY) : 1,500
Straight of 6 : 1,500
Players need to reach 10,000 points to win.

boardgame.name: Master of the Elements
boardgame.description:
Master of the Elements is an element-themed part strategy, part luck card-centered game where players aspire to be the first to master the elements by one of three methods: maximum power in each element, summoning 5 spirits, or playing a 9 card mastery set.

Players take turns going through the phases each round (referred to as the "season"). Cards corresponding to the season have a bonus. Each season, there is a lead player who chooses a special universal modifier. It could be a draw bonus, it could be to prohibit using/summoning spirits or to prohibit special cards from being played.

The cards, spirits, element power levels, and seasons all interact in a synergistic way throughout the game. Cards can allow you to draw more cards, put a spirit into play, or boost your element power level. Spirits can help you draw more cards, boost your power level, and more! Higher power levels means you may be able to draw more cards.

Do you go for element power? Can you summon enough spirits? Do you change your strategy along the way...

boardgame.name: Microscopia
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Book:

"- Desde su enorme fortaleza despliegan sus ejércitos en la noche. Millones de bestias se alimentan de los cimientos de nuestra colonia, secuestran a nuestras larvas y las crían como esclavos. En la lucha no conocen la piedad, en el campo de batalla, no conocen la derrota. Ahora, es el tiempo de que recuperemos lo que es nuestro...

General Máximus, guerras del Peloconqueso

Echa un vistazo hacia abajo

Bajo nuestros pies, a un metro de profundidad, cinco millones de habitantes mueven los hilos de la política, desafían la ingeniería con obras dignas de cualquier emperador clásico y desplazan sus ejércitos en pos de lo que les pertenece. A su alrededor, enormes monstruosidades con fauces terribles, mortíferos venenos y múltiples apéndices con pinzas, garras y tentáculos pegajosos. ¡Y olvídate de los dragones!

¿Nunca soñaste con ponerte en el pellejo de un invertebrado más pequeño que un céntimo de euro? Seis patas, dos antenas y miles de hermanos que dan la cara por ti. ¡Coge tu lanza, ajústate el casco y lánzate a la muerte! Decide tu destino entre las más de nueve profesiones diferentes, o si lo prefieres combínalas con las trece razas disponibles, para jugar todas tus bazas contra la mantis religiosa que asola la zona".

Translation by socnart:

"- From their enormous fortress they unleash their armies in the night. Millions of beasts feed from the foundations of our colony, they kidnap our larvae and they breed them like slaves. They know no mercy in the fight, in the battleground they known no defeat. Now, it´s time to recover what´s ours...

General Maximus, Peloconqueso Wars *

Look down!

Under our feet, one meter below, five million people move the threads of politics, defying engineering with constructions worthy of any classic emperor and move their armies after what they rightfully own. Around them, big monsters with terrible jaws, deadly poisons and lots of arms with pincers, claws and sticky tentacles. And forget about Dragons!

Have you never dreamt of being an invertebrate smaller than a 1 cent euro coin? Six legs, two antennae and thousands of brothers who will die for you. Take your spear, adjust your helmet, and face death! Decide your destiny between more than nine different professions, or if you want, combine them with thirteen available races, all to play all your cards against the praying mantis who scourges the land".

* [Tranlator’s Little Helper note]: Untranslatable pun about the Peloponnesian War.

boardgame.name: Spectra Forma
boardgame.description:
Matching colors and shapes is easy, right? what about matching both at the same time, while keeping your opponents from scoring their best play? Look out for a possible spectrum bonus! Add to the longest shape path! And don't forget to pay attention to what pieces your opponents have left!

This strategy game is easy to learn, but challenging enough for many repeat plays. Each player has his/her own set of colored shape pieces. Players take turns placing pieces and scoring as they go. Will you have the most points when all the spaces have been filled?

boardgame.name: The Lash of the Turk
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

With the fall of Jerusalem, Europe learned a new synonym for bogeyman - "Turk." Organizing the Moslem forces of the Middle East with discipline and training, the Turks recaptured the Holy Land and gradually took over the rest of Asia Minor and spread into Europe like a slow tide, including capturing Constantinople and swallowing the remnants of the Byzantine Empire and the Balkans. Presuming extreme cruelty, various European leaders called for new crusades, to free fellow Christians from "the Lash of the Turk."

The game covers the tenuous period in history when all of Christian Europe felt threatened by Suleiman the Magnificent, Turkey's greatest sultan. Would Hungary be the next prize for the Ottoman Turks? Would Vienna follow, and the dam of resistance collapse entirely? You decide.

One side features various forces from Europe, who sometimes seem more divided than united by their "common religion." The other side includes the might of the Ottomans with new "allies," vassal states who prefer their new overlords to being part of the Holy Roman Empire.

Designed by Andy Nunez, The Lash of the Turk features 176 large counters and a 22 by 34 inch map covering the area from Graz to Bucharest. Units represent various columns of infantry, artillery, and cavalry. Game rules stress ease of play, but give players lots of options, including river movement and combat, siege rules, forage, and political turncoats. Four different scenarios let you juggle the strengths and weaknesses of the principal leaders for both sides, along with Austrian, Hungarian, Transylvanian, Tartar, Turk, Bavarian, Polish, and Franconian troops and appearances from other nationalities. Can you can hold off the Turks? Can you conquer new lands for Allah? Find out, in ATO #30.

Our Terms and Conditions
1. General
All transactions between Gamers HQ and you, the customer, are subject to the following conditions, which you acknowledge by accepting delivery of your ordered products. These conditions do not affect your statutory rights and in all cases German law applies.
2. Orders and prices
We do our level best to ensure that the information on our website is up-to-date. Please note that offers and prices are subject to change. We work to ensure that our prices are all correct, but cannot be held responsible for accidentally displaying the wrong price of a product.
All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) — preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (§312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data — in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) — is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.
8. Other matters
We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Such cases arise only very exceptionally; we try to ensure that everything we advertise in our web shop is in stock. Where, for whatever reason, we are unable to deliver we promptly refund in full everything you have paid.
9. Limitation of liability: external links
Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.
11. Severability clause
If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

The Crown vs. Dr. Watson
boardgame.description:
It's 1894, and Sherlock Holmes has been presumed dead for the previous two and a half years. Watson's story, "The Final Problem," seems to confirm the loss of the great detective. Seeking to fill the void left by Holmes, you are asked by Mycroft Holmes, Sherlock's brother, and a reluctant Scotland Yard to investigate the murder of Sir Terrence Milton, a London businessman. The evidence points squarely at Dr. Watson, who had an altercation with the victim shortly before his death. Can you uncover new evidence and expose the murderer?

boardgame.name: Shadows of the Empire Planets Guide
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

"The Shadows of the Empire Planets Guide features comprehensive coverage of the new planets of Steve Perry's best-selling Shadows of the Empire novel - from geography and politics to military organizations and famous people. Each chapter includes detailed adventure outlines. You and your group can be exploring the planets of Shadows of the Empire in no time.

- Visit Greedo's jungle homeworld of Rodia, where hunting is not only the planet's favorite sport, but the most-honored profession. Just take care that you are the hunter and not the prey!

- Vergesso Base is a very carefully hidden shadowport where all manner of scum and villainy gather to do business with the underworld. Get tangled up in the spice trade or the Rebellion, free a few friends from the slavers guild, or help fend off an Imperial assault.

- Land on Bothawui and enter a world of spynets and intrigue. Immerse yourself in the Great Game by finessing the defection of an Imperial bureaucrat, or head for the wilderness to face predators with more direct ways of dealing with you.

- Head for Kothlis, the frontier world of Bothan space. Run a sabotage mission Borsk Fey'la, or try to track down a missing Imperial courier droid before the Imperials can."

boardgame.name: Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled Again
boardgame.description:
After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. Not all of them were kind and happy wizards, but the old royal mage made sure to leave some nasty tricks behind just for them. Traps and curses of all kinds were left strewn about his hiding places, now being plundered by the wizards seeking to replace him. Will they survive to claim the prize?

Lootin' Wizards: Curses! Foiled again is the first exciting expansion for the group card/board game where you race around trying to get more loot than your opponents. Now, not only can you make spells to battle each other, but curse them and their items to slow them down. This crazy expansion introduces a new character (the evil Alchemist Art), the ability to play with up to two more players in a game (up to 8 when used with the basic game), and a great mix of new Spell and Loot cards to add to the mix.

boardgame.name: The Broken Rules Compendium
boardgame.description:
Subtitle: An All-In-One Guide to Preventing Powergaming in Dungeons & Dragons 3.5

Publisher's description:

We all know the type: The Powergamer, the Munchkin, the guy who tries to "win" D&D. And more often than not, he pored over the rulebooks for months and found just the right combination to overpower both the enemies and the rest of the party. What's a DM to do? See it coming and head it off at the pass.

This book contains all of the most easily-twisted rules and powergaming tricks in Dungeons & Dragons 3.5 Edition, along with tips for handling powergaming players and evaluating new supplements, and suggestions for turning broken rules into plot hooks.

boardgame.description:
For two minutes at a time, based on the clues given on each card, a team tries to find an appropriate rhyming pair of words with the proper number of syllables each (1, 2, or 3).

After the two minutes are up, the team receives points based on the number of syllables (1, 2, or 3) for each card. First team to 50 points wins!

I have a Hink Pink for...
a French pancake for a gorilla or chimp
"Ape Crepe"

I have a Hinky Pinky for...
a fine rain or mist that sounds like fat frying in a pan
"Drizzle Sizzle"

I have a Hinkity Pinkity for...
a large, Australian jumping marsupial that is late

The basic difference is represented by several slight modifications meant to make it more difficult to keep track of the opponent’s strength and intentions.

boardgame.name: Coral Sea: Campaign Commander Series
Coral Sea: Campaign Commander Series Volume II
boardgame.description:
Campaign Commander Volume II: Coral Sea

Coral Sea is a new volume in the Campaign Commander series and simulates the campaign in the South Seas of the Pacific between the spring of 1942 and the spring of 1943. The Japanese expansion reaches its limit in the archipelago of the Solomon Islands and New Guinea. The Japanese initial force, the Army of the South Seas, began to expand reducing the boundaries of the Australian defenses from its base in Rabaul, the logistic center of Japanese control in the zone.
The naval-air battle of the Coral Sea was a hard blow for the Japanese force since the Soho, their light aircraft carrier, was sunk, and the amphibious invasion force destined to take Port Moresby had to return to Rabaul without fulfilling their mission. Afterwards the imperial forces tried to take Port Moresby by a ground assault, extending their way along the Solomon Islands creating air bases and observation stations throughout the archipelago.
The Japanese forces were thus threatening naval communications between the United States and Australia. In response, the Allies reinforced Australia and the New Caledonia zone looking for an opportunity to counterattack and to stop the imperial tide extending through the region. The return to Australia of veteran units from the Middle East allowed the Allies to initiate an offensive in Papua/New Guinea that would last six bloody months and result in the Allied recovery of the enclaves of Buna and Gona on the North coast of New Guinea.

In the Solomon Islands the North American counterattack began August 8th, 1942 and led to a lasting and bloody campaign through February 1943, with successive attacks and counterattacks of both sides resulting in Guadalcanal Island back in American hands. In addition to the ground forces, the region saw much use of air and naval operations. Both navies accomplished herculean tasks to support their respective ground forces and supply them. Their importance was noticeable, so air attacks on navies were numerous, and expensive in lives, planes and ships. The last of them in this period was the battle of the Sea of Bismarck, which resulted in Allied air supremacy in the region.
The Japanese Imperial navy based on the island of Truk made several raids in the region to support the small naval forces in the South Seas. But eventually the Japanese had to yield the initiative to the allies in the region as they exhausted their resources, fighting on two fronts. The Allies exhausted the Japanese offensive, and they prepare to take their own offensive.

The game is developed in an operational scale – area-based map with a scale 1:300,000. It is designed for two players with one running the JAPANESE forces and the other the ALLIED forces. The game lasts approximately 3-4 hours and uses a two sided system to handle the mechanics of play: cards and counters. The players will have to use their troops and their resources to obtain victory points while eliminating enemy forces and occupying cities in the map. It is not a card driven game as the cards are used to bring about events that influence battles, secure reinforcements, and provide resources with which to carry on the fight.

In the beginning of the game the JAPANESE player will take the Initiative and will have to expand throughout the map to secure Victory Points. The ALLIED player is on the defensive, and will have to strength his forces as the game progresses. He will have to take advantage of every opportunity to inflict damage on the advancing Japanese forces. The island of Guadalcanal will be crucial as the game develops, as are the results of actions in Papua/New Guinea.
The JAPANESE player must face the historical dilemma of concentrating on taking the Solomon Islands, Papua or both simultaneously. The ALLIED player will have to be patient and force his opponent to extend himself, by accumulating forces and to committing lethal offensives that put the forces of the Empire of the Rising Sun in check.
Like all the games of this Series, the rules are simple and straight forward. Our objective was to create games that are very interactive, and offer players a pleasant creative experience. We aim for solid games for players who do not have the time or the space to leave a game setup and in place over a long period of play.

listing.notes:
All games are new and in their original wrapping and all prices include the German VAT (7% or 19%).
We offer only goods that we have in stock.
We ship worldwide – please ask for a quote about exact shipping costs (rest assured that we always try to keep them as low as possible).
Payment may be made by Paypal or bank transfer in advance.
For orders above €50 we grant a discount of €5 on shipping costs.
If you have any questions, feel free to send us an email (laden@gamers-hq.de), give us a call (+49 30 79706126) or visit our homepage (www.gamers-hq.de).
Our Terms and Conditions
1. General
All transactions between Gamers HQ and you, the customer, are subject to the following conditions, which you acknowledge by accepting delivery of your ordered products. These conditions do not affect your statutory rights and in all cases German law applies.
2. Orders and prices
We do our level best to ensure that the information on our website is up-to-date. Please note that offers and prices are subject to change. We work to ensure that our prices are all correct, but cannot be held responsible for accidentally displaying the wrong price of a product.
All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) — preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (§312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data — in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) — is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.
8. Other matters
We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Such cases arise only very exceptionally; we try to ensure that everything we advertise in our web shop is in stock. Where, for whatever reason, we are unable to deliver we promptly refund in full everything you have paid.
9. Limitation of liability: external links
Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.
11. Severability clause
If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

boardgame.name: Goblins
boardgame.description:
Have you ever played a Fantasy game, killing hordes of useless and stupid Goblins? Prepare to find yourself on the other side of the barricade… Waves on waves of Goblins try to conquer the city of the humans, through debatable strategies, inconsistent plains and brainless "Epic Death".

Goblins is a not collectible card game that melds the bases of the board game with those of the card game.

Raze the town to the ground and loot everything you can find on your way to leading a mob of stupid Goblins! Other Goblin commanders will collaborate on this task as well. Unfortunately, the idea of collaboration among Goblins is a little bit ambiguous. Dealing with useless subordinates and treacherous allies, the enemy will be the last of your problems.

Players must destroy the Town and conquer as many Land Cards as possible. Land Cards will award the owner Victory Points. The player with the highest amount of Victory Points wins the match.

To reach their objective players can rely on Goblin commanders, the alter ego of each player on the battleground; each of these has unique and particular ability to make every game different from the other.

Unlikely Machines, fearless Goblin heroes and a lot of Action Card make the game always unpredictable.

The innovative game system is based on " Goblins flipping". Every choice you make will cause Goblin flip to determine its life or its death. Every Goblin is represented by a disk with two faces: every disk shows a Goblin face on a side and a Goblin skull on the other side.

The game is exciting every moment also when it isn’t your turn. No player will ever be too strong or too weak and the game strategy will change turn after turn suiting better possible the situation.

Through the system of the exhilarating "Epic Deaths ", your Goblins can commit mass suicide in eccentric ways. The “Epic Death” can confuse every enemy and allows you to beat him for the dismay. No player is ever out of the game.

Let the fight for stupidity begin!

Power in Magic, Power in Creation

boardgame.name: The Strings
boardgame.description:
Since 2012, the Strings (GM guide) now forms part of the main Icar core rules. It has been vastly updated and improved!

User summary:
This book is a gamemastering guide for Icar. It contains an overview of general gamemastering skills and information on Icar-specific gamemastering.

From the Icarian Model: Prologue:

The Icarian model is a set of tools and rulings to allow a GM run Icar in its full manner. Regardless of your GMing experience, Icar is utterly different from anything else you have run. This is not a selling point, it is a fact.

The Icarian model initially makes more work for the GM but allows far more depth and colour to any campaign setting. If you really like to GM but have trouble creating in deep, meaningful, different, vast and consistent campaigns that allow the players to do just about anything then this is the system for you.

Of course, not all the tools will be useful for every GM but to play Icar to the full, all the assets below must be used. You can run Icar in a more linear manner, but experienced players may baulk at being forced into a linear setting. Most of the Icar non-speci?c rules can be ported to other game systems with little effort and this is encouraged for the GM with too much time on their hands!

boardgame.name: Rommel's Quest For Jesus Tel el Elisa July 10-15, 1942
boardgame.description:
The area the Australians had taken on July 10th included the coastal ridge from Point 26 up to Point 33 and extended from the coast, south to the railway line. The surrounding terrain was flat and open, offering little or no cover. In such a flat expanse, ridges and rises a mere twenty or thirty yards above sea level give commanding vantage points to their occupants. The height advantage is so slight that one can scarcely appreciate it until actually upon the feature. The 26th Brigade began the difficult task of digging in while reinforcements of artillery, anti-tank guns and machine guns were quickly brought in. Rommel now gave his inevitable response; an all out counterattack to retake this vital ground using threadbare units. Over the next five days, holding this salient would prove extremely tough, with some places changing hands several times. At times the shelling on Tel el Eisa itself made it too hot for either side to occupy.

The Game

Each turn is 12 hrs, with 400 yard hexes. Units are company and platoons for AFVs.

After the Australians had nearly ruptured the Italian line on July 10, Rommel diverted many of this available troops to stop the hemorrhage as it threatened his rear area. However, the coastline ridge of hills and the Hill of Jesus (Tel el Eisa) barred their success. Once the Australians had secured their advance and held the hills, Rommel had no choice but to try to seize them back and from the 10th through 15th, this is what he did.

boardgame.name: Sticks
boardgame.description:
Sticks is in the Rummy family of card games. It is played with 2- 8 players with 4 decks (including jokers). Melding of sets and runs is similar to Rummy but each player has their own goal (written on a "stick"). Players have a hand of 15 cards and goals ranges from the use of 5 to 12 cards.

Each round players draw new sticks (goals) only if they completed their stick during the previous round. Those who did not complete their stick must try again to complete the same stick in the new round. Winner is the first to 7 sticks. A scoring variant is sometimes used where the game ends at 7 sticks but each stick is valued by the number of cards necessary to complete the goal.

boardgame.name: Squish Blocks
boardgame.description:
Squish Blocks is an abstract strategy game where players lay square colored cards to create a board. Players try to create a situation of sandwiching a different colored card between two like color cards. When this occurs, the player captures the block in between and scores the points. Players may capture multiple cards in one turn.

Games can be set up for short or quick games depending on the size of the board created. Games can be as short as a couple of minutes and perfect for multiple quick fun games.

Introduction text:

Nemesis is designed to combine the speed and deadliness of the One Roll Engine (as seen in Godlike and Wild Talents ) and the Madness Meter (as seen in Unknown Armies ) to recreate an atmosphere found in horror classics Nemesis is dark horror, designed to emulate the works of H.P. It is a complete gaming resource for playing everything from a 1920s adventure into darkest Africa to a Delta Green investigation into a downed alien spacecraft. boardgame.name: Jungle Speed: Lapins Crétins
Jungle Speed: Rabbids
boardgame.description:
In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes in order to rid yourself of cards and win the game.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards, and players take turns revealing one card at a time in separate piles. If two face-up cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the totem in the center of the table. The faster player then gives his face-up cards to his unfortunate adversary. To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the totem by mistake. Whoops! Mess up like this, and you must take the face-up cards of all opponents. Other cards force all players to grab for the totem at once or otherwise change game play.

Jungle Speed: Rabbids adds a few twists to the basic Jungle Speed game, starting with a "Raving Rabbids" character that sits atop the token. If a player grabs this Rabbid – even when someone grabs the totem by mistake – she can give a card from her face-down stack to the player of her choice. Other cards have players race to create rabbit ears on their head or grab the Rabbid without knocking over the totem. Another special card forces everyone but the active player to close their eyes, while the active player moves the totem to some point on the table within reach of everyone; the other players (with eyes still closed) then race to find the totem first using only their hands. Don't gouge your neighbor too much!

boardgame.name: Sitzkrieg
boardgame.description:
Sitzkrieg is an expansion set for Axis and Allies which includes a new board sized 80 x 150 cm, an Excel based IPC-tracker, printable battleboards and a PDF based printable rules set.

The set comes without plastic figurines, so you need at least any of the Axis and Allies games with all major powers present or spare parts from Xeno Games to have enough figurines for all nations. The playable nations are: Germany, Italy, Japan, USSR, Chinese Communist Party (CCP) Kuomintang (KMT), France (Free & Vichy), Netherlands, neutrals and Britisch Commonwealth Nations divided into UK, Canada, South Africa, India and Australia.

The map offers you geographical features such as rivers and mountains that have their own influence on the units. When set up, the game starts with a couple of events that took place before 1939. You have to roll for the Second Sino-Japanese war and for the Spanish Civil War to start with. The Long March, The purge and the Winter War all take place in what is called turn zero.Starting turn 1 you may roll for nation specific technologies. Urban Warfare, Burma Road, Lend Lease, Convoys, International and Territorial Waters, Ports, Elite Infantry, Partisans, Spanish Blue Division, Political Leaders are elements that enhance the realistic feel of the game.

The goal is to win a bronze, silver or gold (historical) victory over your enemies.

Rules for which Axis and Allies and Xeno pieces can not be used:
-Weather effects like rain, heat, snow, fog and wind effect your troop's mobility. You can make your own weather markers or use the Litko Aerosystems weather markers.
-Oil Derricks (we recommend Petropolis pieces) and oil drums (we recommend the supply counters from Axis and Allies Battle of the Bulge)
-Commanders (we recommend 1/72 scale minis, Table Tactics jeeps or Axis and Allies miniatures commanders) Commanders allow surrender or retreat options.
-Elite Infantry (we recommend 1/72 scale minis or AA Miniatures

To get all the miniatures to play all the rules is a bit of work, but remember you can also use them to make house rules for your regular Axis and Allies games or use the Sitzkrieg rules as an expansion to your own games.

boardgame.name: From Stone to Steel
boardgame.description:
Subtitle: A d20 System Guide to Arms & Armor from the stone-age to the Renaissance.

From the back cover:
"From the dawn of history, mankind has made war. In every age and civilization, people have developed tools of warfare. From the remotest primitive tribe to the greatest empire, every culture has created weapons for hunting, protection, conflict, and defense against the same. The record of history measures their successes and failures. No campaign world could ever hope to be as varied and diverse as our own. Despite fantastic races and locations, every fantasy world recycles themes mirrored in our own histories, myths, and culture. But many cultures go unnoticed or un-examined in role playing games. Many games become limited by our narrow views of what fantasy is, and can be.

No longer.

'From Stone to Steel' is a book of weaponry and armor, but it is also an examination of history and cultures. From age to age, every culture has approached similar ends and concepts with its own unique perspective. 'From Stone to Steel' is not merely a simple list of items, but rather an explanation of their use, their cultural significance, even their drawbacks. Besides weapons and armor, 'From Stone to Steel' contains new feats, new skills, new prestige classes, and new mechanics. Through each chapter, topics like tactics, special materials, training, and culture are discussed, so that they can be understood and placed in any campaign world. And though these items are based in history, suggestions are made for their inclusion in fantasy world. You'll even find items of myth, fantastic construction materials, new spells to augment weapons and armor, even inclusion of fantasy racial items (based, where possible, on myth or legend).

From stone-age primitives to the height of the Renaissance, history is in your hands. 'From Stone to Steel' - Never look at d20 gaming the same way again!"

boardgame.name: OGL Ancients
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:
"Welcome to the past that never was. OGL Ancients is a role-playing game set in a world long past, where Greek heroes do battle with hideous monsters and artificers work mechanical miracles, while priests petition the Gods for their divine intervention. Witches weave spells in secret glades under the full moon and the spirits of the dead really do revisit the living and wicked spectres lurk in the pestilent places of the earth. This is an environment that many will not have ventured into before. Instead of taverns, castles and dungeons, the setting is one of great temples, amphitheatres, pyramids and hanging gardens, where wise or corrupt kings rule over their sprawling empires and wars are fought for the hand of one beautiful queen.

Set before the rise of the Roman Empire, OGL Ancients focuses on the two most influential civilisations of the ancient world, the Egyptians and the Greeks. Drawing upon historical depictions of weapons, armour, equipment and societal structure of other, more fantastical and mythical elements, such as the wrangling of the Gods and the emergence of colossal monsters in keeping with the strong fantasy of this heroic golden age of myth.

If you have ever wished to sail with Jason on the Argo, to dare the labyrinth in the footsteps of Theseus or to twist men's bodies into the shapes of swine like Circe; if you would besiege the white walls of Troy or fly amid the clouds on winged sandals. If you would learn the secrets buried in the hearts of the pyramids meet with the witches on lonely mountains then venture forth as something greater than the Iliad is born...

The world of OGL Ancients is one where true heroes are remembered forever and where a man favoured by the Gods can rise from the humblest of beginnings to command the world."

boardgame.name: Mischief & Mayhem! (Revised Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

For years, players of fantasy games have stormed the dungeons and strongholds of evil sorcerers, warlords, and just plain bad guys as heroes: knights, wizards, druids, paladins, and more. Heroically they have braved the darkest pits, the foulest creatures, and the most perilous of quests.

This, however, is not such a game.

Welcome to The Imp Game, Mischief & Mayhem! Rather than taking on the role of one of these namby-pamby heroes, players in the Imp Game take on a much more entertaining role: that of the common, dungeon imp! Servants of a wannabe dark and quasi-evil overlord, players scour the world in search of items of power, foil the plots of "evil" Adventurers, and clean out the dungeons whenever needed, getting themselves into mess after mess with the only way out is to help each other!

The Imp Game is a wonderfully hilarious game for 2 to 5 players of all ages. The Imp Game features a powerful "Failure" mechanic that captures the feeling of inept but stupidly lucky sidekicks, ensuring that success is inevitable, but who succeeds at what?

Mischief & Mayhem! is the first product released for the Imp Game.

boardgame.name: Instant Spandaus
boardgame.description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for WWI planes similar to the game Instant Thunder and Instant Bandits. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns.

Planes have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each plane to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Planes may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting is performed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the planes are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and very complete aircraft statistics.

Welcome back to the crazy, upside down, cliched world of The Imp Game with Neo Productions brand new Big, Dumb Heroes! Leave the evil and mischief behind as you create your own epic, bumbling fool! Big Dumb Heroes is the perfect title for a light evening of play or as a back-up game for nights when the GM isn't prepared or a player is missing from a serious campaign. Set up and play in less than 10 minutes, game for hours!

boardgame.name: Klingon Armada
Starmada: Klingon Armada
boardgame.description:
Klingon Armada is an official conversion of the Setting: Star Fleet Universe to the Starmada rules. Players can fight one-on-one duels, but Klingon Armada is particularly suited for fleet engagements. The rules are simple, but not simplistic.

Each turn, players simultaneously write orders for all of their ships, and then the orders are executed in turn order. The mechanics for combat are simple, but there is large amount of variety in the weapon effects. Ships lose effectiveness from damage until they are expanding clouds of debris.

Klingon Armada can be played with miniatures or counters from the Game: Federation Commander series.

This book includes quick-start rules and 40 starship diagrams (from Klingon Border and Klingon Attack).

Additional books with more starships are planned.

Integrates with:

Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
Romulan Armada

Die Welt des »Schwarzen Auges«

In Aventurien, dem fantastischen Land des »Schwarzen Auges«, warten unzählige Abenteuer auf Sie. Allerdings, man muß die Gesetze des »Schwarzen Auges« kennen, sonst ist man verloren. boardgame.name: Allansia
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

The world of Titan is an extremely dangerous place. Mankind and its allies huddle in fortified settlements, for beyond the castle walls the wild lands stretch across three continents. Out in the wastelands, Orc tribes war with each other for dominance. Savage monsters roam at will in search of food. Evil sorcerers ready their inhuman armies for battle. No one, surely, would venture out into such inhospitable places - unless the rewards were so great a hero couldn't possibly refuse!

Allansia is the third volume in the Advanced Fighting Fantasy series, and within its pages you will find rules for designing and running adventures in the savage lands of Titan. In Dungeoneer you ventured into the deadly underground realms in search of treasure. In Blacksand! you dared enter the crime-ridden cities and towns. Now it is time for YOU to explore the wilderness, in search of the greatest rewards of all!

boardgame.name: Progress
boardgame.description:
Progress is an LDS trivia game designed to help stimulate an interest in studying Mormon Doctrine. Players answer trivia questions in order from easiest to hardest. Each successive card is worth more than the preceding card. Players earn the highest points answered correctly. For example, if a player correctly answers a 2 point question and a 5 point question but misses the 10 point question, he or she would earn 5 points. The first player to earn 200 points is the winner.

Question categories are:
Book of Mormon
Old Testament
New Testament
Church History
Church Doctrine

boardgame.name: Heart to Heart
boardgame.description:
Heart to Heart is a card game designed to help stimulate conversation between friends and family members. Each card has a a question printed on it which players have to answer. Some are very general and others are more personal such as "What attracts you to the opposite sex?" and "What was your most romantic moment? Did you initiate it, or did you receive it?" There are Mystery Cards which players can use to keep their answer a secret (to avoid revealing things they don't wish to).

A variation of the game requires you to answer the questions for the other player with the person who answers the most correctly being the winner.

boardgame.name: Anno Domini: Adventus Averni ad Terram
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

“Pugna ad Animae Tuae Saluten Consecuendam Parata Est”

El Infierno ha caído sobre la Tierra y yo vivo en él.
Con la última campanada que anunció el año de Nuestro Señor de 1000, las hordas del Maligno invadieron el mundo y, en siete días, conquistaron, capturaron y arrasaron. Dos siglos y medio después, la humanidad permanece cautiva en las ciudades de la Tierra demoníaca, donde los demonios torturan, vejan y tientan para corromper almas.
Pero, ocultas en los bosques y en las montañas, pequeñas comunidades de humanos libres sobreviven esperando el Día del Juicio Final, el día en el que el Mesías volverá a la Tierra a reclamar a los suyos. Hasta entonces, los Justos de las tres religiones del Libro, aquellos a los que Dios ha dotado de fabulosas facultades, se enfrentan al Maligno, sus huestes y servidores, para proteger a aquellos que aman y cumplir los designios del Altísimo.
Un mundo de oscuridad, criaturas de pesadilla, grandiosos actos de fe, épicas proezas del espíritu humano. En todo esto os sumergiréis en este incierto camino que habéis decidido recorrer.
Mi consejo es el siguiente:
Comportaos como hombres justos.
Vivid como hombres libres.
Luchad con decisión cuando debáis hacerlo.
Vuestra alma es en realidad vuestra única y más preciada posesión, lo único que merece la pena en este mundo de oscuridad. Él la dejó a vuestro cuidado; custodiadla con honor y fe, mantenedla pura. Permaneced atentos: hoy, como jamás nunca fue, el Mal acecha...

Derra: brujo, alquimista y aspirante a demonio

Translation by socnart:

“Pugna ad Animae Tuae Saluten Consecuendam Parata Est”

Hell has fallen on Earth and I live in it.
With the last bell toll that announced the Year of Our Lord 1000, the Devil’s hordes invaded the world and, in seven days, conquered, captured and razed. Two and half centuries later, humanity´s held captive in the cities of the Demonic Earth, where demons torture, humiliate and tempt to corrupt souls.
But, hiding in forests and mountains, small free human communities live waiting Judgement Day, the Day when the Messiah will return to Earth to claim his own. Until then, the Justs Ones of the Three Religions of the Book, those who God have given fabulous faculties, struggle with the Devil, his hosts and minions, to protect those who love and to fulfil the Almighty’s designs.
A world of Darkness, nightmare creatures, great acts of faith, epic deeds of the human spirit. In that all you´ll be submerged in this uncertain road you have decided to walk.
My counsel is this:
Act like Just men.
Live as a free men.
Fight with decision when you must.
Your soul is, in fact, your only and most precious possession, the only thing that is worth in this world of darkness. He left it in your care; watch over it with honor and faith, keep it pure. Stand alert: today, like never before, Evil’s lurking...

Derra: warlock, alchemist and demon apprentice.

boardgame.name: E4 = Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion
Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion
boardgame.description:
E4 (Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion) is the first official expansion for Experiment.

This expansion gives the players new options to choose and new strategies to play the game.

E4 introduces a new card type: the special lab card.

Special lab cards are mysterious, no player may look at them before taking them. You never know what you are going to get ... it might be a double colour joker but it can also be a normal one colour flask or even an empty Erlenmeyer.
The card remains hidden for your opponents so they won't know what you have until you use it.
An empty Erlenmeyer can even give you in certain situations the edge of winning a close game with half a point.

E4 also adds 6 new secret lab cards for even more fun.

boardgame.name: Extreme Paranoia
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A huge 128-page must-have rules supplement for Paranoia by the Traitor Recycling Studio.

Illustrated by Jim Holloway.

Up to now your players have been Troubleshooters of lowly Red Security Clearance. Now, in Extreme Paranoia, they can become characters of any clearance from Orange up to the powerful Violet - and they'll still be paranoid!

- Orange - TV actors in loyalty-inspiring Alpha Complex sitcoms (That's My Commie!) and dramas (CSI: CSI Sector).
- Yellow - Assistant retail sales managers - no, wait, don't put the book down! It's harrowing true-to-life pressure, but funny!
- Green - Emergency Disaster Response Teams, celebrities who help out at disaster scenes (often by creating them).
- Blue - Internal Security troopers with awesome armor, brain-curdling weaponry and utterly impossible assignments.
- Indigo - Secret agents infiltrating traitorous societies, R&D mad scientists plotting revenge, revenge I tell you, hahaha!
- Violet - Executives who are rolling in money, run entire portfolios of service firms, and are unbelievably, deeply screwed.

Plus new living quarters, social clubs, a tour of AlphaNet, and a nerve-wracking trip to the Happy Fun Job Placement Center!

BONUS! New Mandatory Bonus Duties like the advertising & branding officer, financial officer and agent provocateur!

- Everything you need to maintain fear and ignorance at all security clearances from Orange through Violet! Explore new levels of paranoid hilarity!
- New Troubleshooter duties and secret society activities for all clearances above Red!
- Things to buy, Internal Security dossiers, and more!
- Unsullied by tedious game fiction from eager yet dismally untalented novices!

boardgame.name: Magic Of Glorantha
boardgame.description:
From the back cover

Glorantha in its Second Age is a world steeped in powerful magic. From the common incantations of the runes, to the reality-breaking spells of the God Learners and the warped mysticism of the Empire of Wyrm's Friends, magic permeates every layer of Gloranthan life.

The abuse of these mighty powers is accelerating Glorantha toward apocalypse, yet the two greatest culprits - the God Learners and the wyrmfriends - refuse to mitigate their acts of corruption and blind zealotry. Yet while they are ascendant, their magical prowess is without challenge.

Magic of Glorantha explores the most essential of these eldritch practices, providing detailed explanations and rules for Dragon Magic, God Learner Sorcery, and the mysteries of HeroQuesting. Additional information is also provided on the subtleties of wyrmfriend society, dragonspeaker cults, and the mechamagical enhancements of the Zistorites. Lastly, Magic of Glorantha provides character assassinations of the major Dragonspeakers and sorcerous lords of the Middle Sea Empire, including vital advice on how to deal with and serve these prodigious magicians.
